    • isInCheck

      public boolean isInCheck(String color)
      Checks to see if the king of the given color is in check. This will be called twice after every move
      Parameters:
      color -
      Returns:
      boolean value corresponding to the king being in check

    • parseInput

      public static int[] parseInput(String move) throws IOException
      Parses the user's string input for a move, with validation.
      Parameters:
      move - The user's input string (e.g., "a2 a4").
      Returns:
      An array of size 4 with the initial row, col and the final row, col.
      Throws:
      IOException - if the input format is invalid.

    • charToInt

      public static int charToInt(char ch)
      Converts a column character ('a'-'h') to its corresponding integer index (0-7).
      Parameters:
      ch - The column character.
      Returns:
      The integer index of the column, or 8 if the character is invalid.

    • canAnyPieceMakeAnyMove

      public boolean canAnyPieceMakeAnyMove(String color)
      Checks to see if any moves are possible. If not, then it is either a checkmate or stalemate, depending on whether or not anyone is currently in check.
      Returns:

    • staleMate

      public boolean staleMate(String color)
      Checks to see if there is a stalemate
      Returns:
      true if stalemated, false otherwise
